messages: 25b4680580f5f4176f11970322f17a5a (16:13): How do I get Apache to run in the background?
915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (16:24): Apache sends "Server: Apache/2.0.59 (Unix)" in each reply; how can I suppress this header line?

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (16:35): PHP is enabled (see http://www.php.net) with 'AddHandler application/x-httpd-php .php .phtml' or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache2.php or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache.php or for windows ask about "php on windows"
915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (16:35): lamp, fajita: thanks, I'll try that

915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (16:37): "ServerTokens Prod" and "ServerSignature Off" help a bit, but the 'Server:' identity line still appears, albeit with less information than before.  Isn't it possible to suppress it entirely?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (16:38): I am a bot. I am not a sentient being. I cannot hold intelligent conversations.
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (16:39): Luyt, the other way would be changing it in the source and recompiling apache
915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (16:39): Heh, yeah.  I was hoping it could be done with a configuration option ;-)
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (16:40): Luyt, no more than what you just mentioned above will allow, read the links
915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (16:40): Well, I'm happy already that the version and platform of the server is not shown now.
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (16:44): Luyt, if you not happy with it, recompile it changing the required stuff. it's not hard, google and some time reading will fix you up.
5d2b8c5990a6b644b88d2d3af22db8cf (16:46): Luyt: with mod_security you can write whatever you like in Server header
25b4680580f5f4176f11970322f17a5a (16:46): when i start apache, if php is loaded correctly or whatever..should it give me a message saying so?
5d2b8c5990a6b644b88d2d3af22db8cf (16:47): though I don't understand what is the point, security through obscurity?
5d2b8c5990a6b644b88d2d3af22db8cf (16:50): Skrowl: did you look at fajitas links?

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (16:50): PHP is enabled (see http://www.php.net) with 'AddHandler application/x-httpd-php .php .phtml' or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache2.php or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache.php or for windows ask about "php on windows"

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (16:50): php on windows is explained at http://www.zend.com/manual/install.windows.manual.php or for Apache 2.2, see http://www.iamcode.net/projects/apache/php-win or ask me about xampp or apachelounge
5d2b8c5990a6b644b88d2d3af22db8cf (16:51): Skrowl: it doesn't matter. basically just load the module, AddHandler (or AddType as PHP docs tell, it works but it's wrong way) and you are rolling
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (16:55): Skrowl, read the docs. the conf is pretty well documented.
6c8811f67f440ce70cc5b4edd7b1caf9 (17:00): ok i got a prob with php .o.O
6c8811f67f440ce70cc5b4edd7b1caf9 (17:01): a php-script is getting access-denied, when trying to send data to a mysql db?
915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (17:12): lamp: Thanks for the tips, I also discovered that 'mod_headers' should be able to suppress the 'Server:' header
f1552c0eb8c424e7a52c1535714523fc (17:14): I just want to know if it's possible to limit access of a single file in httpd.conf and not by .htaccess, any idea ?
f1552c0eb8c424e7a52c1535714523fc (17:15): wow, what a quick answer !
f1552c0eb8c424e7a52c1535714523fc (17:15): Thanks, gonna dig this way ! :)
77276cde892307ce6b7a98500d1f406c (17:16): Yeah, and you wasted a lot more than that on 4chan.

915d3af313228110587a6a97fb3b869d (17:45): Grrr.... "The Header directives are processed just before the response is sent by its handler. These means that some headers that are added just before the response is sent cannot be unset or overridden. This includes headers such as "Date" and "Server"."
